systems.description: A mapping of system identifiers to their configuration

modules.description: A mapping of module identifiers to their configuration

worlds.description: A mapping of world identifiers to their configuration

versions.description: A mapping of Foundry VTT version numbers to their configuration

item.description: Configuration for a single system, module, or world

name.description: The display name of the item

manifest.description: The URL to the manifest file. Provide either a non-empty 'manifest' (URL) or a non-empty local 'file' path.

path.description: Path to a local archive or directory, or a URL. Provide either a non-empty 'path' or a non-empty URL in 'manifest'.

install_at_startup.description: Whether to install this item at startup

continuous_sync.description: Enable continuous sync for this item. Boolean true uses type defaults; object allows overrides.

enabled.description: Enable continuous sync for this item

source.description: Host source path. Defaults: worlds=/host/shared/worlds/<id>, modules=/host/resources/modules/<id>, systems=/host/resources/systems/<id>

delete.description: When host-to-container, delete files not present in source (default false for worlds, true for others)

interval.description: Optional per-item sync interval in seconds (falls back to SYNC_INTERVAL)

check_presence.description: If true, emit a non-blocking warning when the item is not present at startup (or after install if install_at_startup=true).

supported.description: Whether this Foundry version is actively supported and should be loaded by default

install.description: Configuration for what to install for this Foundry VTT version. Each map's key is the id from the top-level maps; the value is an optional partial override for that id.

systems.description: Map of system ids to optional per-version overrides. Use an empty object {} to install as-is.

modules.description: Map of module ids to optional per-version overrides. Use an empty object {} to install as-is.

worlds.description: Map of world ids to optional per-version overrides. Use an empty object {} to install as-is.
